page.title: 17Sealink Ferries.
page.content: There are{two Sealink Ferries}that leave Weymouth.They are called the {Earl Godwin and the Earl Harold.}They both go to the{Channel Islands}with passengers going on holiday.The ships go to{Jersey and Guernsey.}It takes about{8 hours}to get to{Jersey}and {6 hours}to get to{Guernsey.}The ships can travel at a speed of 18 knots but they only travel at 3 Knots when they leave the Harbour. Sealink hire a boat that takes cars and passengers from{Weymouth to {Cherbourg in France.}It takes just over{4 hours to get to Cherbourg}from Weymouth. The ships can carry about a{thousand {passengers and 180 cars}or a mixture of cars and lorries.There is a{twice {daily Service to the Channel Islands in the{Summer months. -Jason Moggeridge.
